CatDescriptText: John Marshall, clerk, Fifth Ward and Carolyn White, secretary, Washington, Pa. were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe there should be another Negro judge in the local state courts - Allegheny County Court and the Common Pleas Court of Allegheny County?"  Mr. Marshall's answer reads: "Personally, I don't see what difference it makes who the person is as long as he is qualified."  Ms. White's answer reads: "I would like to see another Negro judge in Common Pleas Court, and I hope that soon there will be a Negro judge appointed to the Allegheny County Court."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Marshall wearing patterned necktie, standing in front of stone block wall, Grant Street, Downtown; Portrait of Carolyn White wearing coat with zigzag strip on bodice, standing in profile in front of Naly P.O. Company, Grant Street, Downtown
